definition: A demarcation line or boundary that separates two regions or countries, often marked by physical features or man-made structures. It is commonly used to refer to the border between nations or territories, and can also denote the limit or extent of something.

examples.german: Die Grenze zwischen Deutschland und Frankreich ist 451 Kilometer lang.
examples.english: The border between Germany and France is 451 kilometers long.

examples.german: Die Grenze wurde durch einen Zaun markiert.
examples.english: The border was marked by a fence.
